intro: Heteropanax bokorensis, commonly known as the Bokorensis umbrella tree, is a tropical plant native to the rainforests of western Africa. It is characterized by its large, umbrella-like leaves that can reach up to two meters in diameter. The plant belongs to the Araliaceae family and is known for its distinctive, compound leaves with a unique arrangement of leaflets. It produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by red berries, which are an important food source for local wildlife. Due to its rarity and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
